definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!

sentences.english: Keefer screamed with pain and rolled on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 吉弗疼得尖聲叫喊，在地上打滾。

sentences.english: The woman, sprawled on the ground, was seen wailing.
sentences.chinese: 這名女乘客四腳朝天地躺在地上，並在地上打滾哭鬧。

sentences.english: The camels rolled in the white dust, raising puffs of cloud.
sentences.chinese: 駱駝在白茫茫的沙裏打滾，揚起陣陣塵霧。

sentences.english: The children enjoyed watching the hippopotamus wallowing ( about ) in the mud.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們真喜觀看河馬在泥中打滾。

sentences.english: Dean Acheson is rolling in his grave.
sentences.chinese: 迪安縠奇遜在他的墳墓中打滾。

sentences.english: The slaves writhed under the master's whip.
sentences.chinese: 奴隸們被奴隸主的皮鞭打得在地上打滾。

sentences.english: Pigs often welter in the mud.
I could see you writhing in pain.
They were very attracted to it, they were rolling in it.
sentences.chinese: 它們被強烈吸引了，直在姜粉中打滾。

sentences.english: And shall cause their voice to be heard against thee, and shall cry bitterly, and shall cast up dust upon their heads, they shall wallow themselves in the ashes
sentences.chinese: 他們必爲你放聲痛哭，把塵土撒在頭上，在灰中打滾。

sentences.english: We all rolled on the floor laughing until Dad finally rescued the vase.
sentences.chinese: 我們都笑得滿地打滾，而後爸爸把花瓶拿了下來。

sentences.english: The little donkey rolled on the ground.
The children enjoyed watching the hippopotamus wallowing in the mud.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們喜歡看河馬在泥中打滾。

sentences.english: Both urban and rural markets so far in the production of small vendors selling horse roll.
sentences.chinese: 至今在城鄉集市均有小攤販製作馬打滾出售。

sentences.english: It's chic. It has the "I roll around in money" signature.
sentences.chinese: 很有高貴氣質，很有“我在錢堆裏打滾”的味道。

sentences.english: I felt so touched! He played with my husband very happily too.
sentences.chinese: 老公用逗貓棒逗他，他玩得滿地打滾，高興極了。

definition: to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!
incoherent speech/to talk without rhyme or reason (idiom)
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
to play/to have fun/to hang out
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
